content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-099-10-A
|Item_parent=Migraine, trigeminal neuralgia and facial pain
|Item_parent_short=Migraine, trigeminal neuralgia and facial pain
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the clinical description of auricular headaches
|Description=Know the positive clinical features that allow the diagnosis to be made.
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=10}}
- '''Otalgia : ear pain'''

o Can be directly linked to a pathology of the outer or middle ear (otitis in particular)

o Or be a projected pain "reflex otalgia" often revealing an ENT cancer.

o <u>See item 150</u>


- '''[[Headache SD-118|Headache]] of auricular cause''''

o Headache associated with ear pain, linked to pathology of the external or middle ear <u>(See item 150)</u>.

question.title: What is a characteristic of auricular headaches?
question.description: Auricular headaches are a type of headache that can be caused by ear pain.

option_a.title: Pain that is only caused by inner ear problems
option_a.description: A type of headache that is only linked to inner ear issues

option_b.title: Pain that can be linked to ENT cancer
option_b.description: A type of headache that can be caused by ear pain linked to external or middle ear pathology

option_c.title: Pain that is only associated with migraines
option_c.description: A type of headache that is only linked to migraines

option_d.title: Pain that can be projected to the ear
option_d.description: A type of headache that can be caused by pain that is perceived in the ear

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
